page.title: 17DANGERS OF COMPTON BAY
page.content: { COMPTON BAY}is a small area of sea in the south-east of the{ISLE OF WIGHT. In the past the cliffs surrounding the bay proved to be deadly to ships; lives were only saved by the braveness of fishermen and lifeboat-men.The old lifeboat was contained in a shed,and was dragged down the beach by a team of strong cart-horses.Nowadays,the lifeboat shed is used as a garage,and when ships are in trouble lifeboats travel from Yarmouth. Compton Bay was also famous as a haunt for smugglers,who often used routes leading from{SHIPPARDS CHINE and{COMPTON CHINE. Today there is little trouble from either ship-wrecks or smuggling,but the people of the surrounding area are always prepared to help.
